STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 2, 2020
Jacquelyn Marry
Fostering Solutions
Suite A
131 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
RE: License #: CB460360419
Fostering Solutions
Suite A
131 S. Winter Street
Adrian, MI 49221
Dear Ms. Marry:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
11/30/2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved. For repeat violations,
please note why the prior CAP did not correct the problem, and what will
be done going forward to assure compliance.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular license will be issued. If
you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (269) 337-5289.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309
enclosure
2

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance with all additional MISEP requirements.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a MDHHS Contract violation. Please note that
there are additional MDHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance with all additional MDHHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
FOM 801 Health Services For Children In Foster Care
Page 14
Medical Passports- All medical information within the medical
passport must be current and updated at least quarterly to
reflect the child's current and complete health information.
Two of six foster care files held Medical Passports that were completed outside of
the quarterly timeframe.
REPEAT VIOLATON:
11/27/18 renewal evaluation; CAP approved 12/11/18.
FOM 722-08c Foster Care- Parent Agency Treatment Plan & Service
Agreement
Upon completion of the parent-agency treatment plan (PATP)
and service agreement, the parent is given a copy for review.
Foster care workers need to ensure the parent understands all
areas within the agreement. Parents and youths age 14 and
older must sign the PATP.
The foster parent/caregiver must be included in the PATP
process. The foster parent/caregiver signature is required and
indicates that the foster parent/caregiver acknowledges and
agrees to the activities required to meet the needs of the child in
their care.
The foster care worker must engage incarcerated parents in the
development of the PATP.
CI 17-096 Treatment Plan Signature Timeframes and
Documentation Requirements
All treatment plans with a report date of August 1, 2017, or later
must have signatures from all appropriate case members within
30 days of the report date.
4

Four of six foster care files did not meet the requirements of this contract item.
File one: 7/6/20 PATP was not signed by the foster parent until 11/9/20.
File two: 6/2/20 PATP was not signed by the parent or foster parent.
File three: 3/5/20 PATP was not signed by the foster parents.
File four: Four PATPs were reviewed for an incarcerated parent. There was no
documentation to indicate the PATPs had been provided to the parent.
REPEAT VIOLATION:
1/20/20 interim review; CAP approved 2/6/20.
11/27/18 renewal evaluation; CAP approved 12/11/18. Previously cited under
ISEP.
FOM 722-6b Family Team Meeting
Page 12
The DHS-1105, Family Team Meeting Report, is used to
capture family demographics, FTM logistical information, needs,
strengths, action steps, safety concerns and the safety plan,
and any recommendations made for the family during the FTM.
The DHS-1105, FTM Report, must be completed for every FTM.
Three of six foster care files did not meet the requirements of this contract item.
File one: FTMs held on 3/11/20 and 6/16/20 did not have an 1105 report completed.
File two: FTM held on 8/31/20 did not have an 1105 report completed.
File three: FTMs held on 3/3/20, 5/18/20, and 8/12/20 did not have 1105 reports
completed.
FOM 722-08E Foster Care/Juvenile Justice Action Summary
Page 3
Placement Change- Prior to a planned placement change, or
within three business days of an emergency placement change,
the caseworker must document…
One of six foster care files held placement change (DHHS-69) forms that were
completed outside of the required timeframe.
File one: AWOL from 3/12/20-3/16/20, DHHS-69 completed 4/10/20. Placement
changed from 3/19/20-3/27/20, DHHS-69 completed 4/10/20. Placement from
3/27/20-4/7/20, DHHS-69 completed 4/10/20.
IV. ANALYST FINDINGS
The analyst report did not identify any safety concerns regarding this agency.
5

V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance.
VI. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation regarding the upload of informed consent forms.
The agency reported they have been instructed by MDHHS to send the forms to the
PMOU mailbox for upload to MiSACWIS. However, the forms are not uploaded
consistently by PMOU. DCWL contacted the policy office for guidance; a response
was received and shared with the agency. Consultation was provided to the agency
to track these forms to ensure they are uploaded timely, then contact PMOU if forms
are missing.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during this
licensing period.
There were two incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period. Both investigations were reviewed during this renewal evaluation. It was
determined the agency completed thorough and appropriate special evaluations
regarding both instances of corporal punishment. The agency also implemented
effective corrective action plans to address the cited violations.
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. The plan was submitted in response to the
1/20/20 interim review; CAP approved 2/6/20. During this review, the agency had
two repeat violations from the 11/27/18 renewal evaluation. The violations were in
the areas of FOM 801 Medical Passports and FOM 722-08c PATPs. In addition,
there was one repeat violation from the 1/20/20 interim regarding signatures on
PATPs, FOM 722-08. The agency reported having some difficulty obtaining
signatures in a timely manner due to COVID restrictions implemented in spring of
2020. However, the agency reports having a process in place now that has improved
signature timeliness.
6

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules, MISEP requirements, or contract. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility will be issued a
renewal of their regular license.
December 2, 2020
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
December 2, 2020
Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
7
